item.title: Microsoft Trust Signing service abused to code-sign malware
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Cybercriminals are abusing Microsoft's Trusted Signing platform to code-sign malware executables with short-lived three-day certificates. [...]

item.title: Coinbase was primary target of recent GitHub Actions breaches
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Researchers have determined that Coinbase was the primary target in a recent GitHub Actions cascading supply chain attack that compromised secrets in hundreds of repositories. [...]

item.title: Oracle denies breach after hacker claims theft of 6 million data records
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Oracle denies it was breached after a threat actor claimed to be selling 6 million data records allegedly stolen from the company's Oracle Cloud federated SSO login servers [...]

item.title: Fake Semrush ads used to steal SEO professionals’ Google accounts
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new phishing campaign is targeting SEO professionals with malicious Semrush Google Ads that aim to steal their Google account credentials. [...]

item.title: Microsoft: Exchange Online bug mistakenly quarantines user emails
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft is investigating an Exchange Online bug causing anti-spam systems to mistakenly quarantine some users' emails. [...]

item.title: US removes sanctions against Tornado Cash crypto mixer
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The U.S. Department of Treasury announced today that it has removed sanctions against the Tornado Cash cryptocurrency mixer, which North Korean Lazarus hackers used to launder hundreds of millions stolen in multiple crypto heists. [...]

item.title: Steam pulls game demo infecting Windows with info-stealing malware
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Valve has removed a game titled 'Sniper: Phantom's Resolution' from the Steam store following multiple user reports that indicated its demo installer actually infected their systems with information stealing malware. [...]

item.title: Veeam RCE bug lets domain users hack backup servers, patch now
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Veeam has patched a critical remote code execution vulnerability tracked as CVE-2025-23120 in its Backup & Replication software that impacts domain-joined installations. [...]

item.title: CISA tags NAKIVO backup flaw as actively exploited in attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: CISA has warned U.S. federal agencies to secure their networks against attacks exploiting a high-severity vulnerability in NAKIVO's Backup & Replication software. [...]

item.title: VSCode extensions found downloading early-stage ransomware
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Two malicious VSCode Marketplace extensions were found deploying in-development ransomware from a remote server, exposing critical gaps in Microsoft's review process. [...]

item.title: Critical Cisco Smart Licensing Utility flaws now exploited in attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Attackers have started targeting Cisco Smart Licensing Utility (CSLU) instances unpatched against a vulnerability exposing a built-in backdoor admin account. [...]
